revised_title: An Analysis of a Stone Found in a Woman's Gall-Bladder
tldr: The author describes the discovery of a large stone in a woman's gall-bladder and its subsequent removal. The stone was found to be covered in crystallized salts and weighed two dram and fifteen grains. The patient had also suffered from hemoptoe, peripneumony, and pleurisy, and an abscess was discovered in one of her kidneys.
